About Me

Here's a bit about myself and what I do:

I'm an organized creative who is able to balance right and left brain activities. I'm a front-end web developer, and I'm also a photographer. This combination allows me to get into the details, but also see the forest for the trees.

From 2014 to early 2018, I was the in-house photographer for Vancouver-based Perfect Company, a software startup that creates food and drink recipe apps. I focused on food and product photography for app, social media, and marketing content. I also shot retail packaging layouts and did plenty of video production.

Since then, I've been a freelance commercial photographer specializing in portraits, professional headshots, and product photography. Some of my clients include: East West College of the Healing Arts, Lensbaby, Wild Chick Organics Skincare, Alchemy Candles, and Summit Learning Charter School.

In 2020 when photography slowed down, I decided I wanted diversify and have the potential for remote work. I signed up for an introduction to programming course at a Portland coding school called Epicodus. I told myself, "If I pass the class, I know I'll stick with coding long term." I passed and kept going, earning a professional certificate in computer science for web programming through Harvard University. I also took courses on Udemy.com and The Odin Project.

Here we are, and I'm excited to combine my front-end coding and photography skills!

Harvard University (edx.org)
